repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Avian Influenza and Human Pandemic
            Preparedness and Response Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Avian Influenza and
            Human Pandemic Preparedness and Response Project for Turkey
            is to minimize the threat posed to humans by highly pandemic
            avian influenza infection and other zoonoses in domestic
            poultry and prepare for, control and respond to an influenza
            pandemic and other infectious disease emergencies in humans.
            The additional funding for goods for the vaccine storage
            warehouse is consistent with the original project
            development objective, project components and activities.
            The additional funding for goods is needed due to changes in
            the design of the warehouse which requires much more storage
            space and thus additional investment in complex shelving,
            forklifts, refrigeration equipment and related equipment and
            supplies.  The current closing date of the Loan is December
            31, 2011, and the need for an extension is not envisaged at
            this time.  The bidding process for the additional warehouse
            goods is underway, with contract signing expected by
            November 15, 2011.  The contract duration will not extend
            beyond the loan closing date and it is therefore expected
            that the goods will be delivered within the remaining period
            of the loan.

display_title.display_title:
Turkey - Avian Influenza and
            Human Pandemic Preparedness and Response Project :
            restructuring  (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Avian Influenza and Human Pandemic
            Preparedness and Response Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Avian Influenza and
            Human Pandemic Preparedness and Response Project is to
            minimize the threat in Turkey posed to humans by the highly
            pathogenic Avian Influenza (AI) infection and other zoonoses
            in domestic poultry and prepare for the control and response
            to an influenza pandemic and other infectious disease
            emergencies in humans. The purpose of this restructuring
            paper is to seek the Country Director's approval for
            the reallocation of funds, in the total amount of Euro 3.6
            million. The reallocation would provide funds for the
            construction of a larger than previously anticipated vaccine
            storage warehouse under the human health component of the
            project. The additional funding for the construction of the
            vaccine storage warehouse is consistent with the original
            project development objective, project components and
            activities. The current closing date of the loan is December
            31, 2011, and the need for an extension is not envisaged at
            this time.  The bidding process for the warehouse
            construction has been completed and the contract is ready
            for signing.  No other changes are to be made to the project
            at this time.
